page.title: 14ECOLOGY of the RHAYADER AREA
page.content: The Rhayader area consists of small fields for grazing or fodder crops, with the higher ground covered with heather and gorse.The River Wye and Rydhir Brook flow through the area, Salmon and Trout being caught in the river. Numerous wild flowers grow in the small deciduous woods and hedge- rows.Two protected wild birds,Red Kite and Peregrine Falcon nest just outside the area but can be seen flying about together with many other birds. Footpaths and Bridleways are well signposted and regularly used by both Ramblers and Pony Trekkers. The area receives a high annual rain- fall causing resevoirs to be built in the nearby Elan Valley. There are no major manufacturing industries and consequently pollution is very low.
